item.title: UID Varrible
item.dc:creator: @SonGoku SonGoku
item.description:
@SonGoku wrote:

ry60003333:

Scrap the freakin UID. Thats not what it is for! Have your client send an extra byte at the end of the login packet. Read the byte, and if it is equal to the one your client sends, then set a value (preferably a boolean) to mark that player as a user of your client. My client appends a special byte at the end as well as it’s own version number, and it still works fine with any server.

Im complete Crap with Clients. I dont know whats wrong with using the UID?

Read full topic

item.title: UID Varrible
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Scrap the freakin UID. Thats not what it is for! Have your client send an extra byte at the end of the login packet. Read the byte, and if it is equal to the one your client sends, then set a value (preferably a boolean) to mark that player as a user of your client. My client appends a special byte at the end as well as it’s own version number, and it still works fine with any server.

Read full topic

item.title: UID Varrible
item.dc:creator: @SonGoku SonGoku
item.description:
@SonGoku wrote:

I want to make it on my server, that if your on my client, it would give you the normal Log in message
But then if your not on my client, i want it to say The link for the client, but they can still play.
So i know my loggin message would have to look like

if(uid = 6 // This is my UID for my Client);
sendMessage(“StuffSTuff”);
}else{
sendMessage(“Please use the webcleint ***Link Here”);

So what is the varrible for the UID ?? I just made that one up.

Read full topic
